paragraph.content: the Commissioner has issued a certificate under section 16A(2), to the employer and the employee; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the employer has entered into an agreement under section 16CA(1), with the injured employee; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: an Ordinary Assessment Board or a Special Assessment Board, as the case may be, has issued a certificate under section 16F or 16G(3), to the employee, the employer and the Commissioner,

subsection.continued: whichever occurs first. (Replaced 1 of 1995 s. 15)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Further to subsection (1), an employer shall not, without the consent of the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: terminate the contract of service or apprenticeship of an employee who has suffered temporary incapacity for a period not exceeding 3 days in circumstances which entitle him to compensation under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give notice to the employee of such termination,

subsection.continued: before—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the period of temporary incapacity has expired; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the compensation has been paid under section 10 to the employee or to the Court. (Added 67 of 1996 s. 7)

subsection.content: Any employer who contravenes any of the provisions of subsection (1) or (1A) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6. (Added 55 of 1969 s. 26. Amended 44 of 1980 s. 15; 76 of 1982 s. 30; 63 of 1992 s. 17; 36 of 1996 s. 25; 67 of 1996 s. 7)

section.name: s48A
section.heading: Legislative Council may amend amounts of compensation etc.
section.leadIn: The Legislative Council may by resolution amend—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the amount specified in section 23(2);

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: the First Schedule; (Added 66 of 1993 s. 17)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the daily rates specified in the Third Schedule;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the minimum amount of insurance cover specified in the Fourth Schedule; (Added 47 of 1995 s. 11)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the amounts and percentages specified in the Sixth Schedule. (Added 36 of 1996 s. 26)

section.name: s48B
section.heading: Amendment of Seventh Schedule
section.content: The Commissioner may, by order in the Gazette, amend the Seventh Schedule.

section.name: s48C
section.heading: Protection of public officers

subsection.content: A public officer is not personally liable in respect of any act or omission of his if it was done or made by him in the honest belief that it was required or authorized in the exercise of any function or power under this Ordinance.
The protection conferred on public officers by subsection (1) in respect of any act or omission shall not in any way affect any liability of the Government in tort for that act or omission.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may make regulations— (Amended 66 of 1993 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
d
paragraph.content: prescribing procedure and fees; (Amended 13 of 1966 Schedule)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prescribing anything which is to be or may be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: generally, for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance and of any regulations made thereunder.

subsection.content: Any regulations made under this Ordinance may provide that such contraventions thereof as may be specified shall constitute an offence and may provide for the punishment of any such offence on summary conviction by a fine at level 3 and by imprisonment for a term of 3 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, by a fine of $200 for every day during which the default continues. (Amended 76 of 1982 s. 32; 63 of 1992 s. 18; 52 of 2000 s. 25)

section.name: s50
section.heading: Rules of Court
section.content: The Chief Justice may make Rules of Court for regulating proceedings before the Court and appeals to the Court under the provisions of this Ordinance, and for the fees payable in respect thereof.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Amendment of references in Ordinances and documents to Workmen’s Compensation Ordinance or Workmen’s Compensation Regulations
section.content: Every reference in an Ordinance or in any document to the Workmen’s Compensation Ordinance or the Workmen’s Compensation Regulations shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be read as a reference to the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282) or the Employees’ Compensation Regulations (Cap. 282 sub. leg. A), as the case may be.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Transitional

subsection.content: Nothing in the Workmen’s Compensation (Amendment) Ordinance 1980 (44 of 1980) (hereinafter called the amending Ordinance) shall apply with respect to claims for compensation or other rights, obligations or liabilities in respect of accidents happening before the date of commencement* of sections 4, 5, 8 and 12 or of section 14 of the amending Ordinance, as the case may be; and without limiting the provisions of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the provisions of the Workmen’s Compensation Ordinance repealed or deleted by the amending Ordinance shall continue to apply to such claims, rights, obligations or liabilities as if such provisions had not been repealed or deleted by the amending Ordinance. (44 of 1980 s. 16 incorporated)

Nothing in the Employees’ Compensation (Amendment) Ordinance 1982 (76 of 1982) shall apply with respect to claims for compensation or other rights, obligations or liabilities in respect of accidents happening before the commencement* of that Ordinance; and the provisions of this Ordinance in force immediately before the commencement of that Ordinance shall continue to apply to such claims, rights, obligations or liabilities as if such provisions had not been repealed or amended by that Ordinance. (Added 76 of 1982 s. 35)

paragraph.name: 1A
paragraph.content: Total permanent loss of the use of a member shall be treated as loss of such member.

paragraph.name: 1A
paragraph.content: Partial loss of a member or partial permanent loss of the use of a member shall be treated as the loss of such proportion of the percentage of loss of earning capacity prescribed in this Schedule as the partial loss of the member, or partial permanent loss of the use of the member, bears to the total loss of that member. (Added 49 of 1985 s. 5)
Where there is loss of 2 or more parts of the hand, the percentage shall not be more than the loss of the whole hand.

Loss of remaining arm, leg or eye, if one has already been lost, shall be the difference between the compensation for the total incapacity, and compensation already paid or that which would have been paid for the previous loss of limb or eye.
Where there is loss of a thumb and one or more fingers of the same hand, the aggregate percentage shall not be more than that in respect of the loss of 4 fingers and the thumb of the same hand.

Where there is loss of a great toe and one or more other toes of the same foot, the aggregate percentage shall not be more than the percentage for the loss of all toes of one foot. (Added 66 of 1993 s. 21)

Where a range of percentage is provided in this Schedule, the highest percentage shall be applied in the most severe case, the lowest percentage in the least severe case and percentages in between according to the degree of severity. (Added 66 of 1993 s. 21)

section.content: Any harbour works, dock, pier, sea defence work, or lighthouse.

section.name: s4
section.content: Any aqueduct, viaduct, bridge, or tunnel.

section.name: s5
section.content: Any sewer, sewage disposal works, or filter bed.

section.name: s6
section.content: Any airport or works connected with air navigation.

section.name: s7
section.content: Any dam, reservoir, well, pipeline, culvert, shaft, or reclamation.

section.name: s8
section.content: Any drainage, irrigation, or river control work.

section.name: s9
section.content: Any water, electrical, gas, telephonic, telegraphic, radio, or television installation or works, or any other works designed for the manufacturing or transmission of power or the transmission or reception of radio or sound waves.

section.name: s10
section.content: Any structure designed for the support of machinery, plant, or power transmission lines.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Specified Amount of Compensation
schedule.sourceNote: (Sixth Schedule replaced 52 of 2000 s. 27. Amended L.N. 93 of 2010; L.N. 126 of 2012; L.N. 31 of 2015; L.N. 30 of 2017; L.N. 60 of 2019; L.N. 42 of 2021; L.N. 36 of 2023; L.N. 43 of 2025)

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Apportionment of Compensation Payable to Eligible Members of the Family

section.name: s1
section.content: If the only eligible members of the family are spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof, then the compensation shall be paid to all of them in equal amounts.

section.name: s2
section.content: If the only eligible members of the family are children, then the compensation shall be paid to all of them in equal amounts.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the compensation shall be paid to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the compensation shall be paid to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 70% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those parents in equal amounts; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the remaining 30% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those grandparents in equal amounts.

section.name: s4
section.content: If the only eligible members of the family are members other than spouses, cohabitees, children, parents and grandparents, then the compensation shall be paid to all of those eligible members in equal amounts.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: children,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 50% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the remaining 50% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are or the eligible members of the family include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: children; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof,

section.continued: then, whether or not there is any other eligible member of the family—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 45% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: 45% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.leadIn: the remaining 10% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in any other case, to all of those parents and grandparents such that 70% of that 10% is paid to all of those parents in equal amounts and 30% of that 10% is paid to all of those grandparents in equal amounts.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 80% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: the remaining 20% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in any other case, to all of those parents and grandparents such that 70% of that 20% is paid to all of those parents in equal amounts and 30% of that 20% is paid to all of those grandparents in equal amounts.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other members who are not children, parents or grandparents,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 95% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those other members in equal amounts.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabities, or any combination thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other members who are not children,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 75% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: 20% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those other members in equal amounts.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spouses or cohabitees, or any combination thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: children; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other members who are not parents or grandparents,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 50% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those spouses or cohabitees in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: 45% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those other members of the family in equal amounts.

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: children; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 80% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: the remaining 20% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in any other case, to all of those parents and grandparents such that 70% of that 20% is paid to all of those parents in equal amounts and 30% of that 20% is paid to all of those grandparents in equal amounts.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: children; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other members who are not spouses, cohabitees, parents or grandparents,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 95% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all those other members in equal amounts.

section.name: s13
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: children;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other members who are not spouses or cohabitees,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: 75% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those children in equal amounts;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: 20% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those other members in equal amounts.

section.name: s14
section.leadIn: If the only eligible members of the family are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: parents or grandparents, or any combination thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other members who are not spouses, cohabitees or children,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: 95% of the compensation shall be paid—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to all of those parents in equal amounts if there are no grandparents;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to all of those grandparents in equal amounts if there are no parents; and

subparagraph.name: C

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the remaining 5% of the compensation shall be paid to all of those other members in equal amounts.
